Perfect place to come for an awesome breakfast!! It's off the strip and had a warm feel. The staff is friendly and accommodating. Get the Coffee Cake!! It is a must have...You're welcome! I would definitely come back when I return to Vegas. Enjoy

My husband and I have been enjoying breakfast at The Cracked Egg for a long time! We had one close to our old place and now we are less than 5 minutes away from this one. This is not my favorite location, but the food is definitely good. 

As everyone has already pointed out, the coffee cake is fantastic. It is not exactly what you think of when people say coffee cake, it is more like a white cake with some fruit filling on the bottom and some delicious frosting on top. My only gripe is that I wish they told you what kind of coffee cake they had that day and that there was just a little more fruit filling.

We usually end up getting a skillet, but they also have delicious pancakes! I am in love with the Kicking Potatoes, seasoned potatoes, bits of bacon, and melted cheddar cheese, served with a side of salsa and sour cream. I also like the option to make your own skillet and if you are in the mood for veggies, the vegetarian skillet is a fantastic option. Most of the skillets also come with coffee cake, win!

Now, I am usually very satisfied with the food, but have received spotty service from this location. Nobody seems too happy to be working here, from the hostess, to the waitstaff, to the manager. I have even seen the manager take on a customer who had a food allergy and was very specific about his order, which they messed up. I don't think it is ever OK to argue with a customer, especially in this situation where it could have gotten really severe if the customer had a life or death allergy. There were quite a few people in the restaurant and the loud exchange was certainly avoidable, I think a sincere apology would have gone a long way. I was also present when they messed up a rather large take-out order for some of my fellow team mates at work and didn't do much to rectify the situation. 

I also really dislike the fact that you have to take your check up to the cash register. That area can get very congested in the morning since it is also the hostess station. If you manage to fight the crowd and make it to the register, I find it quite uncomfortable that they ask you how much tip you would like to leave. I don't understand why they can't just let you fill out the receipt like every other business. Overall, the food is good, but don't prepare to be WOWed by the service.
Try the country Benny and put some cholula on it. It's amazing. Sooooooooooo good! Also our server, Juan, was very nice and always coming to check up on us. 5 stars just for Juan!
I tried this place because it had good reviews on Yelp. Big disappointment! As soon as I walked in, I thought to myself,
The decor in this place is non-existent. Both my lunch order, as well as my girlfriend's was just as appealing as the decor in the place. Would definitely not come back here!
This place this amazing! If you can get away from the Strip do so and come here for breakfast or lunch. The chicken fried steak was great and the cakes and eggs combo was good.

Best breakfast place I've been to here!! I got the southwest omelet and it was YUMMY! Wow who thought of that one? I will be trying this at home. 

5 stars on service 
5 stars on food
5 stars on cleanliness 

I can't say much else!
Excellant breakfast, usually take my clients here prior to showing homes. would recommend number 1.

Love coming here and have a big breakfast.  Perfect for a morning breakfast after a night out or just a good way to start off a lazy day.  Service is good but not great, but hey, you should come for the good food not the service
Excellent breakfast place! The huevos rancheros plate is the best.

I had an incredible experience here. I ordered biscuits 'n gravy which arrived to the table no more than 5 minutes after I ordered it. And boy was it good. Best breakfast restaurant in Las Vegas in my opinion. Service was also great. Highly recommend this place. Location: 215 and green valley.

Good place for breakfast. I heard about the coffee cake and I did try it. It wasn't bad but nothing that would make you eat here just for that. Nice portions and friendly service. Big crowds on weekends not so much on weekdays.

My husband and I really enjoy this establishment.  We have never had a bad experience here.  Once I did order something and they were out and the manager compt my meal entirely.  That is good customer service.  They are always busy but you can see why when you get your food.  Definitely recommend this place for breakfast!
Went on a Saturday morning around 11am only about a 15 minutee wait for us.  Omg the coffee cake...  make sure everyone in your parties gets something different so you can try it all!
The food was okay. The crumb cake they serve hot was amazing but the eggs Benedict was just average.
Our first time here.  Great service and atmosphere!  Loved what my husband and I both ordered. We will definitely be return patrons.

Its always superr busy when we go have breakfast here, so just be prepared to wait a little. The coffee wasnt all that great. I really like their potatoes here. The seasoning on them is delicious. The pancakes were really good just also really expensive. For two people our bill was $36 bucks.

Classic American Breakfasts.  Had the Benedict, non-traditional with spinach and tomato, a great choice. 

Way better than a Denny's or Coco's but they could be used as an example of what corporate/franchise America would do to this place given the chance.

Good breakfast place, really nothing special, but not horrible either.  Wife's tropical french toast was dry and overly sweet. The place was full of diner's so they do have a following. The coffee is strong and good. Sugar dispenser and more creamers would be nice. We will have to try again sometime, but probaly not likely.
This place is always great!!! Delicious food! And great service! I would definitely give it a try! We go there after a night a drinking whenever we visit Vegas lol!

Every once in a while I have this crazy craving for EGGS. This visit, I was on the hunt for an egg scramble. 

I have been here before but never really pleased my palate. This time, I would like to say that I was very happy and full (for the entire day) with my meal. 

I got a scramble... Lucie's Scramble! Made with 3 eggs (yikes!) sausage, onions, bell peppers, mushrooms.... with 2 slices of giant muenster cheese melted on top! Not a single ingredient was lacking, and the portions are nothing short of plentiful. Yum 

I wanted to change up my order and avoid the coffee cake and seasoned potatoes (which are good, but distract me from my main meal). Went with the hash browns and toast, and I think I will followup on my decision next time. Yes... there will be a next time, regardless of the spotty service. 

As noted in previous reviews... service is a little on the off side, but not BAD. The food is totally worth it. Can't wait for my next breakfast outing.

This is always our first pick for breakfast! Upsides? Coffee cake, efficient servers, and delicious eggs Benedict! Downsides? Always a wait esp. on Sunday. Maybe they need to expand, make better use of space, or let you reserve online. We live close so we could wait at home :-)
Smokey room egg stuffed pancakes lets just say stay away. The only good thing was the coffee and service but if you want good tasting food find the many other options in LV.
I love the corn beef hash and its very FILLING  me and my friends left very satisfied

You will not be disappointed from the food, drinks, service and perfect temp in the room. Not too cold but not warm. Just an enjoyable first time experience here for Breakfast. I enjoyed their Denver omelette and rye toast with Iced Tea. Perfect way to begin a day!
Really awesome place to have breakfast. Try the Taylor Breakfast with polish sausage & Make your own skillet with polish sausage delicious :).Staff are very friendly.

The Cracked Egg is a fantastic place to go to for breakfast or brunch. I have been in here several times with a few different people and I always order pancakes whenever I'm here. Usually it's busy every time when we come here, but it's always worth it!

Stopped here on the way back home (thanks to Yelp) food was good and service was fast. Coffee cake was the bizoomb. Seasoned potatoes were very tasty. My husband and Son both ordered the Big Bad Wolf omelet....if they had some New Mexico red or green chili this place would be excellent!!!!
The hostess staff are friendly and nice.. The service good,, the food served hot and fresh.. I have not had a bad experience or a unsatisfactory meal.. Will be back again

We ordered our breakfast here for our bachelorette brunch, we just picked up our food and took it home. Ashley made it completely easy to order, we had ordered a tray of bacon, eggs,'potato, coffee cake, and it was priced at $9.95 per person. We had so many leftovers!!! Our food was ready on time, making the whole experience so smooth and easy. Definitely will recommend this as a catering option!
I just called in an order the girl was rude on the phone hopefully the food makes up for it.

Stopped by here because on a rare occasion, I felt like having breakfast.  The service was pretty slow though, the food was really good though, a little better than the ordinary.  Had the eggs benedict, good hollandaise sauce and the eggs were perfectly poached.

Don't miss the duck tacos BOMB. On wednesday you can get happy hour w half price bottles of wine. Hummus is good but the fresh made bread/pita they servith it is awesome but they never give you enough so order extra. (They charge for extra bread which is kind of lame but still good).

We've been to Sammy's a bunch of times and always have had a good experience. The restaurant is laid out in 3 very separate areas. The gaming partition is completely separate with a separate entrance (only a shared bathroom). On entering the main restaurant, to the left is a more traditional dining area. To the right is an airier, more casual dining area, with some couches and some tables, with lots more light. We've come for HH and had the chicken lettuce cups (excellent!!), baba ghanoush, hummus, and dip sampler. Not disappointed with any of them. The pizza is thin crust. Quite good. This last visit I had the shrimp angel hair pasta. It has roasted mushrooms and artichoke. I asked for light lobster cream sauce - they made it perfectly. And as usual, service was excellent.

Just had a long lunch at Sammy's with friends for a total of seven people.  The waitress was very attentive and was very thoughtful to suggest running separate checks to make it easier on the diners.  She was around frequently to refill drinks without ever having to be asked.  We ordered different wood fire pizza's and various salads.  I shared a thin pizza with sun dried tomatoes, pine nuts and goat cheese and it was so flavorful, fresh and light , I then shared a chopped salad with chicken with a very light red wine vinaigrette.  It was so fresh and delicious.  The serving sizes are very generous and the prices extremely reasonable.  New to the Henderson area,  this was the best restaurant I've been to.  I'm sorry I didn't remember the server's name but we were the only large table at 1 PM so many thanks for a great lunch.  For many of us at the table, this was our first time and we will definitely be back.
Sammy's is amazing every time I come. Great Service and the food is outstanding. The Hummus and Duck Tacos Rock!!!

My wife and I frequently dine at Sammy's Woodfired Pizza and Grill on Green Valley Parkway in Henderson, NV.  We have found the menu to be varied, appealing, and tasty.  The entire staff, from managers to servers, have great people skills.  They are very friendly, efficient, and make us feel welcome.  Last night, March 2, are server was Jess.   Although they were extremely busy, Jess was very accommodating and timely with our meals.  In the past, we have also had exemplary service from Dawn and Rachel.
just went again and it was awesome! Jamie Mandy Leo Ashley are just so super friendly! thank you for an awesome new year hope everyone is safe and happy.

Was surprised to see this restaurant so slow for a Saturday night. We walked in and were sat immediately. Service was fast and friendly. The drinks came quickly and so did the refills. We ordered a Sicilian pizza and a large salad. Pizza was delicious and so was the salad. Grilled chicken on top of the salad was warm. The salad was large enough for two people. Don't make the mistake of ordering that whole thing for yourself. I really can't complain about any of it. The atmosphere is above and beyond what I would expect for a Sammys. I would go here with my friends.

I love Garrett, I'll start there. 
I also love the lebni. My friend got me into it and I literally felt myself coming back for not only how awesome Garrett and Amber are, but because I've become obsessed with it! Burrata and pesto pizza is my fave as well as the Greek salad, however my favorite favorite?! Is Garrett and Amber  hands down!!
Salted Caramel Pudding

Had an incredible customer service experience this evening. Two to three servers tag teamed my table so all my needs were met in a timely manner. On top of that, when I went to order my salad, the server was honest and said some people did not care for the dressing because it is quite tangy and recommended I have it on the side. That turned out to be a great recommendation! I appreciate honesty and great service & will definitely be back!

I came for lunch, and like most places lunch service fails. The servers couldn't hold plates properly. Their arms looked as if they were going to wobble off. They also sucked at clearing tables. The menu was hot mess!!! Asian, Mediterranean, Italian,  Mexican,  tapas, pastas, pizzas. Uhh... yeah. I couldn't figure out what to order! It took me forever. Normally I'd start ordering everything that looks appetizing, but nothing caught my eye. Maybe because I didnt know where to look.  Also im baffled at how huge the salads were, but then the entrees are so so, and you only get a soup cup of 8oz. It makes no sense!!! Like is the salad an entree? I'm so confused as to what is going on. The only reason I gave it a two was because it looks really nice inside.
Never order delivery from here!  I didn't receive 1 of my 3 items, and my goat cheese pizza has no goat cheese on it!  Plus I asked for no mushrooms on the pizza and it's covered in them
Ask for Zack!  He takes care if business and makes you feel at home without kissing your ass.  Happy hour here is a must.  Half off appetizers, cheap drinks.  I'm coming back!

BEST SERVICE AND FOOD EVER!!
 Erick has been our food server several times and he is spot on! Our drinks were never empty and the food was AMAZING!! The manager (Len) was very attentive to all customers, which is a plus.... shows he cares about his restaurant and the quality of service and food his team is serving.. I highly recommend this Sammy's.. if you're
looking for Great customer service and Excellent Food this is the place!

My family and I went there for my birthday. I have very high expectations seeing it's my birthday dinner. I choose to give them my money which will never happen again. It took 20 minutes for someone to take our order, I never knew my servers name, when the order was taken 2 entrees were not entered into the system.  Dressing was not brought and forgotten about. The chopped salad was the worst salad ever. No server came and asked if everything is ok. So here's my advice.... Do not give a server a busy station, servers need to communicate with customers as people because last time I check I was a person and I can be talked to about anything. The manager was absolutely amazing and I thank him for that but no service recovery helped us. Please retrain your servers. The customers deserve that for giving you their money and are there for a positive experience so they will be repeat customers. I hope this changes because it's just another checked off place that I will never go to.
area
craft

I'm urging people to avoid this place at all costs. My daughters and I ordered a pizza. It was terrible. A frozen pizza from Smith's would have been better. The service was as bad as the food. The server seemed to go out of her way to avoid us. Then she overcharged us & the manager had to make corrections to the bill. There are many good restaurants in the Henderson area.  This isn't one of them.

Great food terrible service. Our waiter ignored us then made it clear he was irked by our presence. Some other waitress stepped in to get our order started.  Maybe it's a shift change or something but a little unexpected here.

Returned a few months ago for a birthday.

Wonderful pear pizza. Good service even though the they were training a newbie server.

The Old Fashion drink was close to expected. The comp birthday treat was really good. The ice cream came in a wine glass dripping in caramel and chocolate sauce. Very unique since the sauce held the glass to the serving plate as well as lined the inside of the glass and was layered over the ice cream.

Yes indeed, will return.

I saw some recent one and two star reviews concerning poor service. Hopefully those situations are major flukes otherwise I'd go somewhere else too.

Before my Yelping days my husband and I frequented this restaurant. We always loved the food and atmosphere, but the service was consistently terrible so we stopped coming here. This past weekend we decided to return and see if they've improved. Our service was great and we can now gladly add this back as one of our go to spots near home. 

The inside of the restaurant has a beach/Florida theme. Plenty of windows allow for a bright dining room. The atmosphere is lively and a little noisy without being too loud. This would be a good spot for families since kids likely wouldn't be heard by surrounding tables. 

The menu offers a great variety of food items. They have a large list of appetizers, pastas, tacos, burgers, salads, pizzas, entrees, and desserts. They offer light options as well as heartier meals. 

Our waitress was pleasant and attentive. She was around checking on us frequently and made sure we had drink refills. 

Chicken Lettuce Cups were a delicious starter. The mixture of chicken, hoisin sauce, and vegetables worked well together. Asian Shrimp Pasta was my choice of entrée for the evening. Everything in this dish was great and the peanut sauce was very tasty. The peanut sauce did make for a very rich dish so I'm not sure I'd order this again, but it did taste great. My husband went with the Spicy Italian Sausage and said it was a good pizza. 

I'm so glad to report that my recent Sammy's experience was better than the last!

Always love coming here! It's right by my house and happy hour 4-6 is AWESOME. Please try the duck tacos and thank me later!! Tried fried calamari for the first time this week and I have to say it wasn't what I was expecting, but I was pleasantly surprised. Service is always great and atmosphere is very nice. Came here last week for game 5 of the Stanley Cup and was surprised at how perfect it was. We sat at a nice table in the dining room facing a tv on the bar and the place a not too crowded, but pleasantly full of Knights fans. Great place!
Must go to Sammy's for the dessert!  They have a great happy hour and beautiful atrium seating.  The pizza is good and has many other options on their menu.

Half off appetizers, cocktails, and $2 off shots from 3-6pm for happy hour!

Tonight we had the duck tacos, meatballs and mozzarella, truffle fries, Kung pao calamari, and the hot stone steak. Everything was delicious, and service was on point!

I would give it 10 stars if I could. We are just visiting and tried it for the first time and got the duck tacos the New York pizza and the garlic bread. Every bit was perfect. It was the best taco I have eaten maybe ever. And the service was friendly and helpful we had Chris as our server . Awesome : ) Loved it : )

Went with a couple ladies from the office for lunch..... we decided to order a few appetizers and just share everything!  We ordered the edamame with toasted sesame seeds, truffle fries sprinkled with romano cheese, crispy coconut shrimp skewers served with an orange-horseradish sauce, hummus with grilled herb flatbread, and a margherita wood fired pizza. Everything was great! I 

Really enjoyed the sauce that was served with the coconut shrimp! Loved the way they grilled the herb flatbread that came with the hummus! And of course- the pizza was delicious also! 

Sammy's is a great choice!

After the yelp elite event (which was fantastic) I knew I had to return to Sammy's for a meal.  I'm glad I did.  I had lunch on a weekday and it was busy.  Not packed, but at least half full.  Very brisk business.  I sat in the kind of half couch tables that face the bar.  VERY comfortable and unique.  Had a good view of the TV, but you have to turn your head slightly.  Service was a little spotty as the bartender was busy.  This is why I usually don't sit in the bar area at restaurants when I am dining.  However, once I ordered, my food was out very quickly.

I had the sliders with fries and added gorgonzola cheese.  Fantastic.  The bun is soft and toasty and did not fall apart.  This was particularly impressive as the burger was JUICY.  The patties are flavorful.  I could use a little more of the sauce, next time I order them I'll probably ask for more on the side.  The fries are good, thin and crispy with some nice seasoning.  

Cool design and atmosphere with a comprehensive menu.  We'll definitely come back.
Had an amazing dining experience! Definitely recommend this place. Freshly made food, way more than a pizza place! Jonathan the GM is a delightful person

I was dining at this Sammys location today with a couple friends and I must say I was impressed. The service was good and our server was very attentive to our needs. The manager Tamara even stopped by to see how our meal was and if we were enjoying everything. I must say I will be back again because of the great service and awesome food. The duck tacos and Balsamic chicken salad are outstanding.

There last night with a group of friends on my recommendation. Terrible, terrible service.  Server skipped 2 people when taking drink orders. Just walked away.  The tapas appetizers were brought out b4 any drinks and in mixed up increments.  2 never came.  Kept asking bus people for our drinks.  Had to ask where the 2 flatbread appetizers were.  Finally drinks show up.  Then main course.  For all but 2 people.  Had to keep asking for their meals.  The rest of us finished our meals b4 they got theirs.  Just a damn shame.  Wanted to see manager on way out but couldn't find.  Makes you not want to go back and I would certainly never recommend it ever again!

Another great late lunch, both of us sitting at the bar with Alecia making
great drinks. Such a comfortable place to hang out for an hour or so in the afternoon. Ciao.
Never had anything I didn't love. Their pizzas are all delish. Marcus works at the bar and always takes care of us

I was never a fan of Sammy's but I will make an exception for this Green Valley location! I love this location!! The 1st time I gave it and tried this place I was hooked! I went back three days in a row!! Lol Great ambiance, yummy food (mini sliders with gorgonzola cheese, pork dumplings, fries with sauce, shrimp & garlic pizza, & fried donuts are my favorites), & their spicy bloody mary's are delicious!! :-P Go check it out, especially during happy hour!! ;)
I frequent Sammys on GV Pkwy, I eat in the restaurant and I gamble at the bar. The food is always amazing and the bar service with Mandy is exceptional!

My Experience:
My friend's step-mom recommended this place. Had dinner here on 12/20 with my friends. I was already impressed as soon as we were seated because they sat us at one of the best tables they had. The hostess sat us at the corner table that had a huge comfy couch. Our table was really nice because we had a view of the street and it was super super comfortable. Our server's name was Anthony (I think). We had wine questions and he was very helpful. After our drinks came we decided to start on their Mediterranean Dip Sampler and they were really amazing! My friends and I ordered own entrées and we were not disappointed at all with what we ordered. Then, as soon as we finished our meal and started talking about dessert our server placed a huge complimentary sundae on our table. The Messy Sundae is a must have because it's like being a little kid again. The sundae was a tall plastic wine glass that had vanilla ice cream in it with caramel and chocolate all over the whole thing topped with whipped cream. It was sooooooo good! 
My overall opinion:
I really like the ambiance of this place. Their furnitures are comfortable. I have no complaints at all about the service our server did a very good job. Their menu looks great. The price range is pretty reasonable. They have a decent wine and beer selections. For a place that opened just a few months ago, I think they are doing a pretty good job. :)
a server will be with us right away.
discuss my concerns.
Our server was horrible he opens up with

which I was like ok mannerisms are lacking for a place like this but ok. So we than place our drink orders. He than comes back after 12min exactly and tells me if he can help us. Which I said my wife still waiting on her tea. He brings the tea and I ask about my water. And place a order for hummus some guy not my waiter brings it out quickly enough. But my server took another 13min to come back and ask if we wanted anything to eat by this time I ask for the check. He than say

in a smart a$$ type of way. Brings my check with no pen I do not know of it was my skin color or what but seem like everyone else was getting quick servers.. I'll never take my business to that one the one on Shara is amazing and will now only go to that one!
Love this place.  Amazing food....great ambience....wicked good white sangria.

I have not one complaint about this place. I norm sit at the bar whn ever Im here. The bartenders are fast and attentive they def make for an enjoyable time and very friendly. The decor is hip and cool love the patio set up and big couches. Food so far so good I hvnt had a dish I did not like and you can order cotton candy for dessert!! Where they do that at!? I will say the drinks are a tad pricey but they have happy hrs and drink deals each night so it makes up for it :)

Just finished some dinner after a long hike & wow, everything I could want. Sat at the bar & Rachel, the bartender greeted me & my fiancé. Rachel was super helpful , describing the food to us & letting us know her favorite drinks & we continued to order some happy hour food, 4-6 everyday. Food was amazing, service exquisite & I highly recommend Sammy's to all our friends & family. Woo woo
Great food! Great service! The managers and wait staff are friendly and professional. Mandy in the gaming lounge is wonderful! She is attentive and is always smiling. Keep up the good work Sammys!

THE BEST CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!! WAY TO GO JULIA!!!! I've lived here for 8 years and have gone to many restaurants, including other Sammy's in Las Vegas/Henderson!  We, myself..my fiancé and our son, came to this location for Mother's Day today and was honestly the best service and food in the entire time I've lived here!!!!  Our Server JULIA, honestly made us feel we were her only customers and the place was packed. She not only gave GREAT customer service, but an attitude that made us feel like we mattered and we were welcome, she didn't treat us like we were just

. She small chatted with us, which was nice and unexpected, and her GM, Rick, came by later at the end of our meal and made sure everything was to our standards, and we were satisfied. I cannot sing enough praise on both of their behalf, and to the rest of the staff. Great dining experience, great food, great time!

The wife and I arrived here about 11am on Saturday morning, when we arrived we were greeted by the hostess who then proceeded to sit us, there were 1 other couple sitting in the room, she sat us near a wall my wife asked if we can sit in the middle, she had a attitude with this rolled her eyes, then made a face to the waitress.
I thought that was rude. Plus the food is not that good and for the price it was Very expensive. We WILL not be coming back here.

I love the intimate setting. Service was great. Prices are fair. 

My boyfriend and I usually order different entrees so we could steal bites from each other's plates, but we both thought the chicken tequila fettuccine sounded good. 
And it was! It's a spinach fettuccine with bell peppers, onions and tequila-lime cream sauce. Maybe the cream was a tad bit too rich for us, but it was delectable nonetheless.

Looking at the pics, I'm bummed out we didn't find room in our tummies for dessert! The messy Sundae and the mini donuts look so good! I can't wait to go back for those!

Quick look: quality and affordable comfort food. Specialty is gourmet wood oven pizzas and massive salads. Very comfortable, open air room - if you can figure out how to get to the front door! 

In depth review: very familiar with this Vegas Valley chain and decided to try it out on a Monday night. After a few minutes of navigation through the adjacent business park trying to figure out how to find Sammy's parking lot and entrance, we walked in and were surprised at how busy it was. Bar had a good crowd for MNF. After waiting a couple minutes we were seated at a large table / booth towards the front (facing Green Valley Parkway). It was a chilly Monday night and they did have one of the sliding glass walls open. I enjoyed the fresh air but my lady was cold (as usual). So bring a sweater or jacket if you go in Fall / Winter season at night. 

Service was prompt. Our waiter was still trying to master the little touch screen they use to take orders. He suggested a flatbread appetizer that comes with three different Hummus style dipping sauces. So we ordered that along with a margarita pizza and a grilled shrimp salad. Explained to him that we wanted the pizza and the salad brought out together as our entrees and that we would split them. So we wait about 25 minutes (too long) and finally our flat bread and dip came out to munch on as an appetizer. As soon as I reach for it another runner arrives with our entrees in hand. Was not too pleased and explained that we just got our appetizer and please take the entrees back. For some reason many quality places in Vegas have this issue with timing and seem to want to turn tables as fast as they can?!

Waiter comes back and apologizes. Blames it on the kitchen (obviously). Either way, we enjoy the appetizer and the entrees come out later. They were great. The salad was massive and could easily feed 2 - 3 people. The pizza was cooked perfect and blew similar style at a CPK or Settebello out of the water! 

We were too full for desert but I could see the tables around us ordering them and they looked delicious. Actually they looked massive and could easily be shared. 

Really not going to hold the issue with timing against them. They are a new spot and obviously need to work out some kinks in their operation. Our waiter was super polite and we think he will be just fine as soon as he masters that touch pad. He did comp the appetizer and our drinks. Manager never came to table to apologize but we are sure he signed off on the comp. Also did not get a good night when we walked out and past the hostess - but thats OK. 

We will be back. It's a really nice casual spot and very reasonably priced for the amount of food they give you. Great location and it should do just fine.
Shrimp and crab dip was bland. The pizza was mediocre at best. Saving grace was the service and atmosphere. Overpriced for sure.

I won't go here again. The best part of it is its interior design. Long waiting time to be served. Waited 40 minutes for breakfast for two. Food is so-so, nothing special, eatable but for Vegas/Henderson is not a criteria. Bathrooms are dirty. Looks like it was cleaned not later then a week ago. After addressing this issue to the manager, I was told they were going take care of it. An hour later when I took my baby to change it was all the same. Then there was trash and dust next to the bar stand... Now I don't feel comfortable eating there, god knows how dirty is their kitchen.  If the place is dirty on Sunday morning I wouldn't go thee for dinner for sure...

I've been eating here for a while, and for good reason. Their duck tacos. That's it. They don't have to have anything else on the menu (although everything else is good too). I cannot go here and not order those. That's all.

Came here for Mother's Day and it was slam packed. Staff was very professional and friendly. We got free Mimosas for the occasion. Our waitress was awesome. We ordered the humus which was really good. My husband had pizza and he really liked it. I had the French roast and it was the best I have ever had. The only issue I had was the music was really loud. We had to ask them to lower the volume a little. They had a live singer that covered great songs and she had a lovely voice. Not sure if she sings regularly but we really enjoyed it. Would totally return.

Food was amazing. Sweet Chili Chicken Wings, NY Style Pizza and Lamb Tacos were delicious.  Service needs some work, not very attentive and didn't know the menu very well.  We are from out of state and would return on our next visit.
Perhaps the best, well o.k., one of the best

in Henderson. As a local who has lived here for over 21 years, trust me.
One of the best parts is that it starts at 3:00 in the afternoon, which means you can miss the business crowd getting off from work. Also it's 7 days a week. HALF OFF all their appetizers....HALF OFF all of their speciality drinks( very generous pours) ......really.. And the food is very  good. Along with great friendly service.....Are you kidding me.......
Enough said......Oh, sit the bar.......And if you really want to make it a fun ending, enjoy one of the best expresso martini's I have ever enjoyed  for dessert. Then try to remember where you parked your car......smiling 
Ciao

The hot rock beaf is lovely, delicious and a lot of fun. If you have a date, order this one! The girl will like it :) 
Shrimp pasta is good!

Last we was the first time dining at this location. The food was excellent. I had the Artichoke and Garlic pizza.  Yummy...especially if you like garlic, it's loaded with it. Our servers was attentive and the atmosphere light and comfortable. I will be back.

Yum yum and more yum. I think I over ate but sheesh it was so good! It was my first time and I got the Mediterranean plate and was super happy, soft hot flavorful pita bread. I also went carb crazy and ordered truffle fries. The crisp white glass of wine was a great suggestion made by the bar tender who was very warm and respectful. Everything I ordered was half off and $2 off any wine at happy hour woohooo =)

I can 't wait to go back

Was meeting up with an old friend and thought we would try out their brunch. First let me start with this...$20 bottomless mimosas! Oh yes! So delicious and they do not hold back on making sure you're refilled when needed. We shared the charcuterie plate which was delicious. Had more mimosas and then she had the breakfast pizza and I had the breakfast tacos. All so tasty! I must say, our server Brian was fantastic and helped make for an amazing brunch!
Rachel and Garrett are seriously the best bartenders in Henderson. They know your drinks the minute you sit down and they take wonderful care of you. Love this place.
troubles

The second time I went here- they missed a topping on the pizza so they put topping on pizza and refired it- which is a no no- great way to give someone food poisoning . and service was terrible.

We decided to try again- since the first time was not bad.  It took 10 minutes to get seated for lunch and then we waited with three children another ten minutes and never saw a server - 

so we left and will not be back

This place is great! They have best margarita pizza I've ever had. The prices are too high and they have a different atmosphere from most restaurants. I would recommend them for groups as well. Happy hour stops at 6 for cheaper food prices so don't come at 7 like I did.

I would have given this place a 3.5 star because I usually enjoy the food.  The service isn't usually that great but no big deal, the lobster bisque and garlic cheese bread (my favorite) out-weighs the not so attentive service.  Last night will be the last time I eat from this place.  I ordered the lobster bisque and garlic cheese bread to go and brought it right home and ate it.  About 2 hours later I began throwing up violently on and off for a couple hours.  Waking up this morning on Thanksgiving of all days still with a very upset and sensitive stomach.  I have no other
symptoms.  I think the need to have someone from the health department come out and check the dates and temps because I definitely got sick from eating from here last night.  Not good at all.

This location is in a sorta strange spot as it's part of a business complex. But it's decorated nicely and has a good ambiance. It has both the normal restaurant area, as well as a 24/7 tavern, gaming area. Service is attentive and friendly in both areas. And hey, I hit 4-of-a-kind twice here, so that's pretty awesome. Happy hour is 4-6pm and has multiple small appetizers and drinks on special. The apps are smaller portions than the regular apps, so you aren't exactly saving a bunch of money. But it is nice in that it allows you to try out multiple apps, as opposed to getting full on just one. All of the food I've had here has been great. I love their goat cheese pizza. And the mac 'n' cheese is fab. I wish they still had the kobe beef hummus, but the regular hummus is still tasty. The meatballs are pretty good too. All in all, this is a great place to play, dine, and do happy hour.

My wife and I have eaten here many times as well as the location on Rainbow Blvd. Tonight was just as fantastic as the previous nights, however our waiter was as good as it gets! Zach was knowledgable, funny, and always kept our glasses full. Keep staff like him around and you'll continue to have our business.

The only reason this is not a 1-star review is because the food was actually good. The service, however, was terrible. We had a reservation for our large group of 12 but still had to wait 20 minutes to be seated. The manager was rude and told us that a reservation was not a guarantee for seating. After we were finally seated, it took over an hour for our food to arrive. It's unfortunate that something as easy to provide as service was so blatantly ignored and that customers were treated as a burden. Get it together or you won't survive the Vegas local's service expectations.
The seating at this Sammy's is better that the other ones. A little more sit down restaurant vibe. Our server Rachel was very friendly and nice!

Poor service at the bar. New York pizza was medicore. Honey pizza was a big letdown. It was more of a cracker than it was pizza or bread; a thin crispy cracker with some toppings on it.  And even at happy hour, it was not a particularly cheap tab; speaking of which, we had to wait forever just to get the tab. I had an empty glass half the entire time I was there. It's just not a place worth going to at all.
mature

For awhile I was on a Sammy's kick and wanted to come here all the time. This spot is close to home and I like the ambiance inside of the restaurant. It has a sort of Florida feel.

The brunch here is great. The menu has a nice variety of options and all of the food is really good. I love the small plates here, especially the Lettuce Cups, Lobster Mac & Cheese, & Edamame. They also have a Raclette & Potato pizza that I enjoyed. It was a thin crust pizza with potato and cheese. It didn't have a traditional marinara pizza sauce making it a little different. Different in a good way. The Salted Caramel Pudding for dessert was one of my favorites too.

Now on to the reason why I don't come here anymore despite the fact that I love the food, ambiance, and location. The service was always a miss. The bad service was the most consistent thing that they do at this location. From slow service with disappearing servers to dirty dishes that sit on the table and aren't cleared I just got fed up. Since I liked the food I kept coming back, but ultimately the bad service started to mar the experience and I just couldn't keep coming here. I can deal with mediocre service for good food, but not awful service. The tables here are tiny and the tapas style lends itself to many plates. I found that we were always trying to clean the table ourselves since nobody would clear plates. Every.single.visit. The final straw was when we came in a group at my suggestion and I felt really embarrassed for even recommending the place.

So, the food is good, but you have to be able to tolerate slow and inattentive service to enjoy yourself here.

We like going to Sammy's... but every time we step in the door we remember how horrible the service always is. The food is great, just an awful lack of service that doesn't match the the dollar signs here. We were seated to our table and waited 7mins until we were greeted and once we told our server our beverage order, she disappeared for another 4mins to grab our waters and my boyfriend's tall Blue Moon. Then, although we were beyond ready to order our food, she disappeared for another  5mins. We were really hungry and really impatient at that point. We felt bad but we just grabbed our drinks and made our way to the bar, as she was taking way too long. The table next to us even noticed our irritation, as they sat there with the same irritation because they had been sitting for a while without service too. As we got up and moved ourselves to the bar, that table next us got up and left the establishment. We obviously told the bartender why we moved and he apologized but hardly had any urgency and the manager was even right there and she didn't even care! It was a rather lengthy late night dinner and we're definitely disappointed, as we always are when we leave Sammy's. Can't come here when I'm in a hurry that's for sure. Guess I'll stick with California Pizza Kitchen for similar menu items and much better service. Doesn't ever get any better at Sammy's unfortunately.

Love the decor and love going here for happy hour. Lots of great little plates to snack on over a glass of wine. The pizza is delicious as well. The service is either exceptionally great, or just okay. Depends on the server. Bonus is enjoying a beautiful day there when they have the sliding windows open.

This place is awesome. Really relaxed and upscale restaurant. Awesome food (I had the sliders and they were literally the best I've had) 

On top of that my bartender Paul was awesome and  knew his stuff. 

Definitely a 10/10 would come again

Love love love this place, it's awesome.  The bartenders are Great and super friendly.  I'm working my way through the specialities and have yet to be disappointed!  I'm thankful to have found this cozy hideout just a week after I moved here from CA.

What a beautiful place.  The decor is lovely.  The very large sliding glass doors were open so we could enjoy listening to the birds and feel the warmth of the sun.  Food was delicious and the service excellent.  Definitely a return trip in our future.
Kobe Chili is amazing! Service way to slow considering the restaurant was only 20% full. Had to ask for refills, etc.  Chinese chicken salad was spicier than other restaurants.

Does not disappoint !!!
Sammy's is a great place to chill with my family , 
My kids always destroy The place and the staff is always nice ! 
Especially Albert !!
He rocks great se


Man this place doesn't disappoint !!
Was thinking about since last time I was here great food !! 
Albert is the man !

Absolutely love this place!  I have been back (since the Yelp event) 4 times!!  The food is so delicious as are the drinks.  I love the non-alcoholic pomegranate drink!!  The gluten free pizza is so much better than most gluten free pizzas and I love how many gluten free options they have!  This place is amazing!!

The half priced apps at happy hour are the best.3pm-6pm. Chicken skewers with Thai peanut sauce-awesome. Duck tacos-awesome. Pot stickers rock. Pizza rocks. This place has always been a favorite and its close by. Staff us nice and always use upbeat. I would strongly recommend.

I have been to two previous locations. 
This one is by the the most visually appealing. The lay out is different than all the others. They have a wonderful bar area next to a full glass window wall that opens up, the fresh air is great reminds me of California style restaurants.

Appetizers : Asian style calamari ( very unique) I highly suggest this. 
Hot Rock: 600 degree rock in a bed of salt, and you get to cook your own beef on it. Very tasty and interesting. Also we had Vietnamese crab stack. That was really good and fresh with real crab, and a little lemon grass ginger flavor.

Had a glass of Pinot and the shrimp and grits . Very good, not something I would ever order, I was being spontaneous that day. The waiter suggested it and it was a GREAT suggestion.The grits are not like grits at all, not a single gritty grain actually. Made very well with a stack of steamed greens.

Our waiter was very nice. His name was Zack. Its rare you find people who actually enjoy their job. There is nothing that makes your food taste worst than a fake good mood. We certainly didn't get it with this guy. He is much appreciated, and made my birthday great.

I love the new location, and will be back regularly.

We ate at Sammy's for the first time Feb 13th. The food was tasty, and our server Albert was very helpful in selecting dishes to try. Looking at the restaurant from the outside, it looks like a typical dark bar/eatery, but what a nice surprise when you come inside. My only suggestion is that Sammy's should have rice as a side dish, it would have really complimented several of the menu

The duck taco appetizer is very good. I had the salmon and it was a little better than average but had a lot of sauce. The atmosphere is super cool with a ton of sunlight. They also open the windows when the weather is appropriate.
I am not a huge fan, but my wife loves the garlic chicken pizza...The drinks are ok, and the staff is always friendly.

With a fantastic yelp event at Sammy's already under my belt, I was really wanting to go back for some great food!  

We wanted to bring our neighbor here since he doesn't live here full time.  He's a 'smooth' talker.  He walked around the restaurant, saw the huge corner table was empty and immediately went to the hostesses to ask for that table.  It was reserved but they hadn't showed up yet and were late for their reservation.   One of the managers said if they didn't show up in 5 minutes the table was ours!   Lady luck!  They sat just the 3 of us at this huge comfy table!  Nice!

Kimberly was our fantabulous waitress!  She was bubbly, attentive and just plain awesome!  We kept trying to talk her into joining us for our meal.  Of course she was working and couldn't explain that one to her boss.  But she was a delight for our entire dining experience.  

Hot Rock appetizer anyone?  It was so good the first time and was just the same this evening.   The steak was full of flavor as we cooked it to our enjoyment.   This will probably be ordered every time we visit Sammy's.   Delicious!

We decided to go family style and split everything we ordered.  This included the Kobe beef sliders with fries and the Hawaiian Pizza.  OH MY!    Full of flavor and perfectly cooked describes both of the items to a T! The thinly sliced pineapple on the pizza instead of chunks gave the pizza an all over evenly hawaiian pizza taste!  I loved this way of preparation because sometimes you just get all pineapple on one piece when it's in chunks.   Hawaiian Pizza ~ A+ !   The 3 kobe sliders were cooked to our liking (medium rare) with cheddar evenly melted on top.  Sometime even the more simple burgers can be the best! 

Sammy's is definitely an asset to Henderson and I can't wait to go back again.  The food and service are definitely top notch!
Zach is an excellent server. Makes sure you get the best deal for your buck and makes sure your drinks are never empty. Food was great!!

Best. Tomato. Soup. Everrrrr!!

...among other things. Amazing Mediterranean Dip Sampler, Kung Pao Kalamari, and my favorite pizzas are the Burrata and Pesto & Marg-herita. 

Must try! Come for tapas, pizza, and entrees.

Loud during weekends, so come around 4-5pm on weekends or during week nights if you like it more quiet.

I only give it 4 stars because the management there is awful.

Clearly and without a doubt, it was Barbara that made our visit fantastic.  Personally I was a little concerned when there was no one at the door when I arrived to meet my dinner guest so I had to venture around, and that was the only hit. After that Barbara took over and made dinner a truly satisfying experience. Food was hot, brought out without a long wait, delicious, and best of all was our Server ... Barbara who has only been there 3 days!!!  She's a really good hire!!

I like this place. It's very cozy and it feels good to be there. During warmer times of the year it looks like they open up all the sliding glass windows. Seems like it would create a really cool indoor/outdoor vibe. Would be a lovely spot for Sunday brunch. (AHEM: bottomless mimosas)

Service was great. Food came out relatively quickly (not TOO quickly, that freaks me out), water glasses were never empty, and the server gave great recommendations and was very friendly. 

Food was okay. Nothing, out of this world amazing, but still tasty. The menu is very broad, one of those we have a little of everything places. Maybe spreading themselves a little thinly and thats why nothing is absolutely stunning. However I would come back here. Good place to go when you have a large group of picky and/or not adventurous people.

Stopped in for brunch and the place was almost empty

When we arrived we asked for the no kids section and was placed at a booth with only  one other couple in the area

Next couple in the restaurant had a baby with them and was placed next to us even after they requested a different location 

Thanks for the no kid area 

Service was S L O W

Waited 10 plus min between empty Coffey cup and refill. Asked for a carafe and it held one cup of cuffed and was empty

Took close to an hour to get served after we ordered and the Couple  seated after us got their food before we got appetizers 

Only saving grace was the food tasted good

Worst service ever...............and I have to say I have been to many, many, many establishments in my long life............Was seated in an area with only one other table of occupants.............they had GREAT service............we were ignored.........food was served to another table........no followup........manager brought bill, but made absolutely no comment...........will not EVER try again...........even tho the meal was Fabulous.............too many GREAT servers in this valley...........will take our business elsewhere..........Me thinks not is SO VERY CORRECT!  additional note: mother with 2 children were seated right before we got our bill..........NO ONE Paid any attention to them either.............and the restaraunt was barely busy..............must be trying for the going out of business thing!

Both Leo and Jamie on the tavern side were amazing! I met a client at Sammy's and both gentlemen were great. Professional and attentive and they both made us feel at home! I will continue to bring clients so long as they make my clients feel at home. Great staff. Great service.

This is a fun place to just hang out with a bite to eat. It is very laid back and has great service.  I love their shrimp appetizer. They even have little dippers for youngsters which my granddaughter adored.

The wine prices are right on par for a dining establishment. They have a decent variety of bottles or glasses. I really like their pinot selections which are not usually offered by the glass. 

They offer pizzas with whole wheat or thin crust. If you ask, they will thin out the wheat crust for you too-my favorite. They also let you add or change toppings. I love to take a great veggie pizza and add some pepperoni. 

Don't forget dessert! Their messy sundae is shareable and delicious!

One of my favorite restaurants over the past 15 years. Great food is an understatement. Service is great, which is the norm. Nice atmosphere. 

One curious thing though, I started to eat at the Green Valley Pkwy bar, and I have to say this, they have the most UNCOMFORTABLE bar chairs/stools a human can experience. Seriously, PAINFUL. Please look into getting something that doesn't pain your customers to sit in!
Great food, especially the shisito peppers...organic kale salad  would definitely get again.
getting it done

Great salad. We discovered an error a week later. Manager graciously took care of it. 
Good food great people.

Food is amazing. The pizza is spectacular. They serve out of the box recipes, so if you're feeling adventurous for a new restaurant, this is the place to go. The decor is also nice and cozy. 

The only downside is how loud it is. The kitchen is not closed off so that creates a lot of background noise and the restaurant doesn't have sectioned walls for seating so noise is traveling throughout. I had to yell at my boyfriend even though he was right in front of me. Kind of ruined the moment. 

I would just order for pick up if you want it to be intimate or want to be able to have a conversation with the person you are with.
I eat here quite a lot. I almost always get the hummus with pita bread. And my favorite entree is the tequila fettuccini dish. The pizza is also delicious, what ever they do to the bread is great!

Ordered takeout. Woefully sad amount of Pepperoni on the Pepperoni Pizzas. I counted 12 1-inch pieces of pepperoni for the entire pizza. Glad they have vegan cheese because of my dairy allergy, but omg it's not a pepperoni pizza with 12 tiny pieces of pepperoni! It's not an expensive product. My friend that got a
cheese pizza also had about 12 pieces, so it's not a vegan cheese trade-off scenario. It's too bad because I liked ordering from a place that understands dietary/allergic restrictions. Boo!

This is a great place! Warm ambience, great food and excellent service. It's not as casual as it sounds so don't show up in your gym clothes. Be prepared for a nice dining experience, and don't forget they have wine Wednesdays, where all wine is half off!
Love this place!!!  Amazing food customer service is great!!!  Salads, pizza what ever you choose is unbelievable!!! It's gorgeous inside been here over 2o times at least!!!
patio
booths

Beautiful restaurant and ambiance.  Phenomenal, creative food.  Superb service.  Easy access location and parking.  5 star-slam-dunk.

Don't forget to try dessert.  O-M-G good.

Great food and fantastic service. Dawn always made sure we were taken care of. The eggs Benedict are the best I've had, banana walnut
Pancakes were amazing.

Great food, lots of variety, great health conscious choices, vegan and gluten free options. Friendly staff and management coupled in a beautiful location. Also,  full menu in 24 hour gaming bar and 2 happy hours all week long, 3-6 & 10 -4. Half priced tapas all the way.  Mm mm duck tacos.
birthday dessert

I'm so particular with most things... but the mini duck tacos, messy sundae, lobster bisque & pizzas always seem to do hit the spot!!!  I could honestly say I've probably had all of their pizzas... And not once have I been disappointed ( my favorite being the thin crust margarita pie )  so go! Enjoy yourselves!

As long-time fans of the Sammy's on Sunset, we were pretty disappointed when it closed. The grilled chicken balsamic salad cravings finally got the best of us, and we decided to venture out and find the next closest location. We were immediately impressed by the new space. There were some more traditional seating options along with some tables surrounded by big, fluffy couches. We were seated at a corner table surrounded by a long, curving couch and we began our wait. 

We waited for long enough for our server to greet us that we started to question whether we should go somewhere else. Just as we were getting up to leave, a server, Jules, hurried over to see what was wrong. She insisted that we stay and promised that they would take care of us. 

And take care of us they did! Jules was really friendly and engaging. I got the feeling that she was providing excellent service because it was the way she operated rather than just because she was trying to smooth over a rough situation. At her suggestion, we ordered an array of happy hour tapas rather than the individual meals that we were familiar with. It turned out to be great advice. We would definitely go back during happy hour because it was so much fun to try so many different little tasty treats. 

The rest of our experience was fantastic. The manager came over multiple times to make sure that we were satisfied. It took a little while for desserts to come out as the dinner crowd arrived, but it was a totally reasonable amount of time to wait for how busy it had gotten. The messy sundae was well worth the wait though. It was just as much fun to play with as it was to eat! The manger came by one more time to see us off and make amends on the check. We'll definitely be back.

This is one of my favorite restaurants but they had terrible service twice in a row now. After ordering Togo tonight, I have already been waiting an hour. I finally received a cold pizza and when I asked for another one they just put it back in the over. I watched the chef . I asked for another and still continue to wait 30 plus minutes. If I wanted to wait this long I would have dinned in. I don't think I'll be coming back after this experience.
I ate the entire pizza. The whole thing. To myself. Then I shamefully googled,
shortly after. The pizza is worth the guilt. Will be back for more.

I absolutely love Sammy's. The food is always delicious and the atmosphere is beautiful. However the last few times I've been in it seems like the staff is getting smaller and smaller. There are no hosts, so you have to wait for a bartender to seat you and sometimes there are only waiters. This has resulted in us sitting there for long periods of time with nobody checking up on us.
No stars tonight waited 10 minutes no one came to our table the whole time  ... But we are gonna give them another chance next week cause the food is so good.

Mike, the bartender here is awesome. I came in here with a golfing buddy after a round of golf with the intention of only staying for a couple hours to have a few drinks and eat pizza, but ended up staying here until 2am having a great time. The pie is amazing as well!

Soooo happy to have found Sammy's here in Henderson. We loved going there when we lived in California but moved away from the areas of their locations. We went last night for New Years Eve, could not have been better! Happy to see the original (to us anyways) menu items. The chicken balsamic salad was as great as we remembered. The margarita pizza, splendid! We shared a Messy Sundae which lived up to its name. Great waiter, minimal wait time. Overall great evening. We will definitely be back to try out the newer menu items!!
Excellent food and atmosphere. Pizza and salads are amazing. Great little bar area in the center. Open walls are great when the weather is nice.

Came in on a Wed evening and was told there is a 30-45 minute wait. On the left side of the restaurant almost all of the tables were not being used, so I guess they are short staffed and only open half the serving floor. Its also pretty loud in there. I'll try and go back to try the food  next week. Hopefully it is a better experience.

I was visiting my gal in Henderson and she raved about this place. We went on 11/17/15 and sat at tables to the right (as you walk in the door) of the bar. The food was terrific and I would not hesitate to go there again for that reason.  The reason for the low star is our waitress. She was curt to the point of being rude.  My gal asked for the Orange-Horseradish sauce as an addition to her salmon, and the waitress say it's not horseradish sauce, it's Orange Marmalade. My gal asked her (very sweetly I might add) to check for her as it's delicious and she's had it before with the coconut shrimp.  The waitress brought her Orange Marmalade with no horseradish mixed in.  We went ahead and ate, then my gal asked for the menu and she, sweetly again, showed the waitress what she was talking about and the waitress said
and walked off.  I wish I had my receipt for the gals name, but alas I don't.  When I come back we'll go there again, but I will refuse service from this rude brunette.
Great salads and solid pizza.  Just avoid take-out.  They send you to annoying bartender.  Shitty service

We dined for Brunch on Saturday, It WAS EXCELLENT! The dining room area was clean, well decorated and quiet so we could visit. Our server Alisia was funny, friendly, helpful and very attentive. The menu options for brunch were great: three different types of Eggs Benedict. The food arrived hot and beautifully presented. What a wonderful place for Brunch. Excellent Service, Food and Atmosphere! We will definitely be back.. Oh and Not To Pricey!

I came here with my entire family after a whole day of noshing. I wasn't necessarily hungry but I had no choice. We normally go to the Sahara location and it was my first time at this location which is close to my aunt's house. I love the interior...classy-looking for a pizza place. 

My favorite is their goat cheese pizza but that's what I always get so it was time to try something different. We got the brie cheese and truffle oil thin crust pizza, wagyu burgers and mini kobe beef burgers.

Brie Cheese and Truffle Oil Thin Crust Pizza:
I love brie and truffle/truffle oil. Our server warned me this was going to be very truffly and fragrant - it was not the case. The brie was strong enough to subdue the truffle oil a bit. 4/5

Kobe Beef Sliders:
The beef patty was juicy. The gorgonzola was great with the burger. Comes with fries. 3.5/5

We had a few family members with very specific requests which were all granted. So, I can't complain. The service was great. Their menu seems it has more items compared to the Sahara location.

Have not had service this exceptional in a long time. Albert was my server and extremely attentive and helpful even when the place was slammed. The greeting from the front door to the goodbye when we left this place is the epitome of hospitality.
chicken salad was dry like the desert. service very slow. unhappy hour is what they should call their happy hour. first time eating here, last time eating here.

We always love Sammy's.  We happen to go during happy hour where all the shareable apps are 1/2 price!   How can you go wrong with that?  So we loaded up on the apps and ordered

Poke
Calamari
Duck tacos
Garlic bread 

All the apps were on point.   The main dish not so much. Ordered the Alfredo and it was runny and watery.  But staff was gracious enough to replace it with spaghetti which was pretty good.  

The star was the crispy donuts with raspberry sauce and chocolate.  Delicious!!!
your back!

Came in for lunch today for the first time. Everyone was super nice and helpful about some questions I had about the desserts. I got the mini Kobe beef sliders and they were rocking. Love the chipotle aoli on them and I added Gorgonzola and it was a perfect match. For dessert, we wanted to get the cotton cnady but we were too full and opted for the crispy donuts, they were a cross between french crulers and funnel cake and simply delicious. Would definitely be back to try some other things!

Happy hour.Live music. The mini duck tacos are sooooo  yummy. Happy Hour has great nosh options and prices for food. Drinks aren't  great prices for happy hour but they are delicious. The bartender is handsome and makes a great cocktail.

Awesome food but the restaurant is almost too fancy now. I don't like the new seating, I felt too low in reference to the table and I felt uncomfortable the entire time. 
The appetizer fries are really good and of course the pizza is amazing.

We love this place, it's one of our favorites. The food is always good, the servers and bartenders are all so friendly and happy. The Brussel sprouts are amazing!! I add salmon to any salad, truffle fries, yum!! Ahi tuna wontons, awesome.... Hummus is great!! They have an amazing happy hour which allows you to sample so many things for great prices!!!!

Hi Julie 

  I never ever seen by management reply to a review, to me that is caring for your customers! I will come again, because the respect you shown to me, this to me is BIG! I was going to say something that day about the hostess, but my wife stop me, and just said don't say nothing, we just won't bother coming back again. I am sorry for bashing your place, but I was steaming, and to be honest the food me and my wife had was good, just the hostess, pissed me off, I never seen that in my life. But Julie I thank you very much for caring, and I will be back again. I am giving it 4 stars as for you and the food. Thanks again Julie
Awesome food. Great environment with live music. We got the pizza and garlic knots. Waiters were friendly and welcoming.

We were there for a Christmas Party which Sammy's really isn't set up for those kind of events but we make due. Some sat at the bar which to me is a better place to sit if you want to keep your glass filled whether it be alcohol or not.

I had the Shrimp with Angel Hair Pasta and it had artichoke hearts, carrots, and zucchini squash which tasted really good. I had asked for some garlic bread but the closest they could come to was their cheesy bread which is more like a small 10 inch pizza, either way very tasty!

My friend had the Chicken Hummus wrap, I looked over and the plate was clean so I have to assume it was really good! ( I mean the plate even look licked clean!!!)

Marcus was our Bartender and was doing a good job of keeping up with the demanding crowd growing at the bar, plus the wait staff coming to get drinks as well, he was busy!!

I'm from out of town, this being my first experience with this restaurant i was impressed with the service behind the bar. First off Matty and crew did a fantastic job with their service. They were quick and attentive and Johnny on the spot with my questions. The drinks had a nice punch and mixed correctly so I could enjoy my meal and not be overly buzzed. The food well the Kobe sliders were nice, the pizza under whelming with first try cold. That was not my gripe, for the true downer to the attentive patron was the manger chewing out in slient fashion the bartenders for a issue with the togo's and taking out $10 from their tip jar. My business opinion, since I own three, is to have dedicated personal for Togo orders. The bar was super slammed with just restaurant business. The star of the show was the service at the bar and the sweet hostess whom picked up my fallen coat from my stool on more then one occasion. The empathy is there with the staff, and so I will be back tomorrow to try something new on the menu, for I recommend this place.
Slow service at lunch however the pizza and the salads were worth the wait. I believe they're a little understaffed but worth the trip there

I loved this place. They have great happy hour specials, service is always great and the food and drinks are amazing. There are several locations and I haven't tried them all but I will definitely be back to this when many times!! And you must try  their messy Sunday!!

Wonderful lunch location. Open atmosphere (literally the walls open), fast service and delicious food. 

I got a pesto chicken wrap with fries and could hardly finish it.
Love the staff! We had dinner and feel in love with the food. We watch Monday night football in their gaming area. They could use some more TVs and they ran out of my beer.

. 
I will go back!

We were a party of 7, 3 kids. I wish I could remember our server's name. She was awesome. I appreciated her accommodating our large and high maintenance party. We did lose her a little bit near the end when the restaurant got very busy...that's why the 4 stars.
We ordered a lot of food from tapas, pizza, and dessert menu. Our server offered suggestions from the menu. All were great tasting. We got a birthday sundae too. The cotton candy was spectacular and a big hit with the kids.

For years we come here for family gatherings over lunch. What to get here: oak roasted salmon, wild arugula salad, crisp Brussel sprouts, hummus and herb flatbread, coconut shrimp and the waygu beef sliders...there's truly something for everyone.

AMAZING FOOD!!! I've been going here since before they relocated. The reason I only have 4 stars is because the service is just mediocre. But the atmosphere is awesome. I recommend  the walnut chicken salad. Hands down best thing on the menu!
Order came out wrong. Food fair. Seats at table uncomfortable. Noise level made conversation difficult.

Absolutely amazing food! The chicken tequila fettuccine and Brussels sprouts keep me coming back time after time. The managers Paras and Jon are always welcoming. Barbara is such a great server and makes the experience that much better! And Garrett's cocktails... the perfect pair to the meal!

Do I love this place? No.
Is it a great atmosphere for friends, family, drinks, and decent food? Yes.
There is nothing above and beyond about Sammy's, except maybe the great service. Every time I have ever dined here, I am pretty blown away by the attentiveness of the staff. 
I also really love the ambiance. You can sit at the bar and watch the game, dine at a normal booth or table, or in nicer temps, they have opening glass doors to a beautiful garden area. If you sit on that side, the booths are more like couches. Perfect for a larger group, or family dinner. 
There are a few menu items that stand out to me. The mini duck tacos, the lobster mac & cheese, and as small as it may seem, the freakin' cheesy garlic bread is pretty bomb. The salads are huge, and the pizza is decent. 
Plenty of selections, including unique options like lamb, and meat cooked on a hot stone right at the table. 
All of the desserts are to die for. Even the huge plate of cotton candy that is enough sugar for 10 kids! 
I will continue to dine here, but it will never be my first choice. Unless it's for cocktails. Great selection.
Props to the entire staff for being awesome.

Food fantastic 
Waitress serving 10 of us was Julia 
She was awesome 
It was my bday and they served us a crazy delicious Sunday 
Thank you Sammy's

We went there Saturday night. It was great. We ordered greek salad, the pasta with chicken and a creamy sauce, which was very flavorful, and wine. It was a price fixed dinner. The pudding dessert was ok, nothing special.  The service was very professional and prompt. also, the rest room was being restocked when I visited, which shows attention to detail that I appreciated.

Arrived at 8:50 pm, we were promptly greeted at and sat by a young man wearing glasses. There were about 8 people at the bar, the bartender said hello as we walked to our table. There were 4 tables dining.  We were told Heather would be right with us. After perusing the dinner choices on the menu Heather arrived. She asked if we would like anything to drink. I had flipped my menu over and as I was deciding between the house chardonnay and the Clos du bois Heather apparently grew impatient. She said I'll get you some waters in a clipped tone. Not more than 45 seconds had transpired since she had arrived at the table. We said water would be great thank you. She arrived back with the waters and said she would come back if we hadn't decided on entrees. We then ordered the crab and artichoke dip. She did not ask if we wanted anything other than water. I felt as though she was judging us, our appearances, and our financial status.  When she came back from placing the appetizer order I ordered a wine and we placed our dinner order. The appetizer was tasty and we enjoyed it while mulling over what Heather's issue might be. While waiting for our entrees we heard a plate clatter to the floor in the direction of the kitchen. We joked that it was one of our dinners considering the amount of time that had passed. 5 or more minutes later Heather comes to tell us it would just be a few more minutes. Ten minutes later she tells us my sliders were burnt on the outside so the kitchen was remaking them.  I work in Hospitality as a Supervisor for a large corporation and have heard every excuse for a long ticket time there is. Blaming the kitchen is a servers go-to excuse. Once the food arrived we were for the most part satisfied with it, but still slightly put off by Heather's demeanor. She was not friendly, nor did she attempt to engage in any manner. We were one of her two tables she was serving at the time. We ate quickly and when she came to clear the plates she asked if we wanted dessert. At this point I had decided against dessert not because I didn't want have dessert but because I didn't wish to be Heather's guest any longer. She brought the check, I placed my card in the book and she offered mini doughnuts to go on the house. Too little too late. I'm not saying we will not dine again because the food was enjoyable once it arrived, I am simply hopeful that should we dine again we get a server that enjoys their job and puts customer service first. We left Heather a 16% tip which was generous considering her service.
Wow.
Let the rant begin. Came for the first time for Happy Hour. First off, $2.00 off of beer and wine. Big deal. Then ordered a Spicy margarita.
Then had a coupon and were told,

The money is not the issue. The issue is not winning over a customer over a few bucks. Once we got our food it was good. Best balsamic chicken salad in Vegas. Would like to see more craft beers. Bottom line, good food but the management doesn't get it. Won't run back to come here.
thing
kinks

I had an unfortunate experience of placing a catering order with Sammy's for an office luncheon, involving 30 executives of a Fortune 500 company. I placed the order 5 days in advance AND reconfirmed my order the following day, to ensure event day would go off without a hitch. On the day of the luncheon, Sammy's arrived 15 minutes late and delivered a completely wrong order for only TEN (10) people. I was so humiliated. All 30 executives had to CHANGE the board meeting agenda so they could eat an hour later, when the rest of my order was delivered. I then asked for a receipt for this second delivery, but Sammy's said there was no receipt since they were going to take these 3 trays of food off the bill anyway, but lo and behold, they charged my card for 2 additional trays, without me signing for the receipt. What a bunch of sneaky liars! Honestly, no monetary amount could have made up for the humiliation I endured while the CEO and the rest of the C-Level executives were waiting around for food. I seriously wanted to hide under my desk. It was my time to shine as event coordinator, but Sammy's completely ruined it. Needless to say, I was and still am traumatized by the incident and never again will I put my job in jeopardy by ordering from this restaurant for any upcoming company events we have. After all, there is a sea of restaurants around Green Valley that offer good food, outstanding customer service AND would value my business.

The combination of the chicken balsamic salad and the service will get me to come back for another visit (and it is two blocks away) the service was great I had my two kids and they were a handful and everyone was super helpful

Will update with more after round 2

The service was so bad that we finally left. We got in there and the hostess was friendly and seated us but after that our server completely ignored us for so long that we finally got up and left. The restaurant was hardly full and the waitress seemed more concerned with flirting with the bar tender than she did serving the customers.

We've brought out-of-town guests to the Henderson location a couple times and both the food and service is outstanding! Duck tacos, Brussel sprouts, pizza, sliders, salad, wings.....everything is so tasty!

I have been coming here since they opened and have usually had a great experience but last night the service was horrible I'm not usually one to complain unless things are really bad. A couple sitting next to us actually walked out due to not getting served. The food was great as usual just lack luster service and it wasn't that busy or I would understand. Hopefully they fix the problems because I think the place is great and I love the atmosphere!

we waited quite a while just to be seated. No one was at the desk to help. We finally got seated and it was very very noisy.

We ordered a pizza that definitely was not what it used to be. we were glad when we had finally finished our meal and got out. We were very disappointed as we have always enjoyed Sammy's before this.

Great Service..excellent happy hour tapas  menu  & 1/2 price drinks. Food was well presented  & had great taste. Olives & toasted almonds were a treat.Had live music
that was a bit loud is only negative. Highly recommend .. Will be back!!

Been coming here for years.  Love the happy hour.

First time for lunch.  Julie I believe was her name was my serve with a gentleman named Rocky.  It was his first day training.  What a great tandem team.   Got to enjoy some conversation and look forward to returning with Rocky behind the bar or serving.

Local resident of Green Valley and GM of a high end steakhouse in Summerlin.  

After a week of work it's nice to go out and feel like a guest.  It feels even better when I can turn the work part of my brain off out dining because the service and food are both on point!

Thank you for the great lunch.  I look forward to returning

Have eaten at other Sammy's locations many times over the years in Las Vegas and Henderson - but my visit to this location will serve as my last visit to Sammy's.
